greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least common multiple of {d-1: d > 1 and d divides n}.
comment: Considering the set of divisors > 1 of n reduced by 1, a(n) is the smallest number whose divisors contain this set;
link: Carl R. White, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: a084190 n = foldl1 lcm $ map (subtract 1) $ tail $ a027750_row' n
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 18 2003
ext: a(45) was erroneously split into 61 and 6; repaired by _Carl R. White_, Apr 25 2012
